title: Gallery Talk: The Ryerson Collection
hero_caption: <p>Workshop of Rembrandt van Rijn. <em>Young Woman at an Open Half-Door</em>, 1645. Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson Collection.</p>
description:
During their lifetimes Martin and Carrie Ryerson traveled the world building an expansive art collection. Join educator Sam Anderson-Ramos to view and discuss some of the artworks that have made the Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson Collection one of the most significant in the museum’s history.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
